meanings.definition: Avoid work or school by staying away or leaving early.
meanings.sent1: Tom always skives off school to go fishing with his friends.
meanings.sent2: She skives work on Fridays to spend time with her family.
meanings.sent3: The cat skives off doing its chores by pretending to be asleep.
meanings.sent4: The student skives off studying by watching TV all day.
meanings.sent5: He skives off work by pretending to be sick, but his boss knows the truth.

meanings.definition: Cut thin slices off a piece of leather.
meanings.sent1: The craftsman skives the leather to make it thinner for the wallet.
meanings.sent2: She skives the leather carefully to create intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: The skiving tool helps to skive the leather with precision.
meanings.sent4: He skives the leather like a sculptor shaping a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: Skiving the leather requires patience and skill to get the perfect result.
